title: Lakers reportedly interested in hiring Kobe Bryant's agent as new general manager
text:
Feb 21, 2017 at 5:17p ET 0Shares 
The Los Angeles Lakers underwent a significant shakeup Tuesday, and the dust still hasn’t settled. Hours after officially hiring franchise icon Magic Johnson as the new head of basketball operations, it appears the Lakers are reaching out to Kobe Bryant’s agent to fill the team’s vacancy at general manager. 
The Lakers already have had discussions with Rob Pelinka, Bryant’s longtime agent, about becoming the team’s next GM and the decision could happen in the next few days, according to multiple reports. The Lakers have had discussions with sports agent Rob Pelinka about becoming their new GM. I'm told this could happen in next few days. 
— Ramona Shelburne (@ramonashelburne) February 21, 2017 Sources: Pelinka emerges as top target for Lakers GM – after LA abandons hopes of pursuing GSW's Bob Myers. Story: https://t.co/P0tvUvEhfg 
— Adrian Wojnarowski (@WojVerticalNBA) February 21, 2017 
Pelinka has a clientele that includes Rockets All-Star James Harden, guard Eric Gordon and Warriors forward Andre Iguodala. But in order for Pelinka to assume the new role he would have to divest from his agency, Landmark Sports. 
According to the Vertical , the Lakers’ top target to replace Mitch Kupchak was Warriors GM Bob Myers, but Los Angeles has backed away from that move after Myers recently signed a contract extension. 
The Lakers fired Kupchak and Jim Buss as head of basketball operations after the team failed to complete a deal for DeMarcus Cousins, a setback that played into the timing of their dismissals, according to multiple reports . 0
